Shahid Kapoor Apologises To His Parents, Says His Respect For Them Has Grown After Becoming A Father

Shahid Kapoor Apologises To His Parents, Says His Respect For Them Has Grown After Becoming A Father

Welcoming a baby into your lives generally comes with a big change. It changes you as a person, and Shahid Kapoor who is embracing parenthood says he has realised the importance of parents in life. Fathers and mothers are real-life superheroes, after all.

Instagram

Opening up about how his life has changed post parenthood, Shahid Kapoor told Filmfare Magazine, “I was pretty self-oriented till I became a parent. Though I believed I was selfless. But when I became a parent, I realised I was actually damn selfish."

Twitter

"Now I don’t put myself first. You end up thinking about your kids and family first. Sometimes it’s nice. Sometimes it’s frustrating because you do need to put yourself first at times. Every individual needs to have their own breathing space. I struggle with it. I respect my parents a lot more today than I did before I was a parent. Now I understand what all they did for me. I don’t know if it’s too late for me to apologise but… I say, ‘Mom and dad, sorry for all those times I was a prick’."

After tying the knot to Mira Rajput in 2015, Shahid Kapoor welcomed his first baby Misha Kapoor in 2016. Little bundle of joy Zain Kapoor brought more happiness into their lives in 2018.

Twitter

Ever since they got married, Shahid and Mira have been under the limelight over their age difference. Finally acknowledging the same, Mira Rajput in an interview to Vogue earlier, said, "His fluidity towards life is another quality I love. It’s helped me ease up a lot. He’s lived longer, so if anything, I can benefit from his experience, and he can benefit from my fresh perspective."

They make a power couple, don’t you agree?
